alert.note: Alert for Duchesne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 5:32PM MDT until August 26 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE EAST FORK BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL DUCHESNE COUNTY... At 532 PM MDT, Emergency management reported a debris flow over Rock Creek Road below Upper Stillwater Reservoir. Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the East Fork Burn Scar. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Rainfall has ended, though runoff may still produce flash flooding. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through Petersons Gulch. This will affect Rock Creek Road below Upper Stillwater Reservoir, including access to the Yellowpine, Miners Gulch, and Rock Creek campgrounds. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the East Fork Burn Scar. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the East Fork Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of West Central Duchesne County FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the East Fork Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
